original_title: Tere Ghar Me Ganga Behti Hai
overview: An orphan, Sarthak, is raised by a couple. As he grows up, Sarthak, along with two friends, raises awareness about serving parents across India and launches a massive campaign to celebrate February 14th as "Parents' Day." He meets with ministers, chief ministers, and officials to gain national recognition for this day.
title: Tere Ghar Me Ganga Behti Hai

overview:
25 December | Mystery of Christmas & Tulsi Pujan Day
A mysterious and thought-provoking story based on school children and the cultural environment around them.
How modern celebrations, social influence, and changing traditions affect young minds.
The story highlights the contrast between Western influence and Indian values, leading to awareness through Tulsi Pujan Day—a message of culture, balance, and moral growth for the next generation.

A story that makes children think, observe, and understand their roots.
title: 25 December wali story | Short Film

overview: Examining the evolution of Valentine's Day from a heartfelt celebration of love into a commercial frenzy, the film uncovers the emotional and societal tolls, challenging viewers to rethink love, consumerism, and self-worth..
title: The 14th February and Beyond | Award Winning Film | Valentine's Day Film

original_title: 25 December | Mystery of Christmas | Tulsi Poojan Diwas | Documentary Film
overview:
Do you know the mystery behind Christmas and Tulsi Pujan Diwas?
Let us uncover the truth, hidden facts, conspiracies, and deep analysis of 25th December.
From 25 December to 1 January, how religious influence and multinational companies impact humanity and society.
How culture and values are affected—and how saints gifted society a powerful solution: Tulsi Pujan Diwas, a symbol of awareness, tradition, and humanity.

Know the Truth • Protect Culture • Embrace Tulsi Pujan Diwas
title: 25 December | Mystery of Christmas | Tulsi Poojan Diwas | Documentary Film
